sentence.Network_en: Professor Smith is recognized to be one of the great scholars in English philology.
sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯教授被公认为是了不起的英语语言学学者之一。

sentence.Network_en: During the Qing Dynasty, philology was a mere handmaid of classical studies.
sentence.Network_cn: 语言文字学在清代还只是经学的附庸.

sentence.Network_en: By subjects : philology , as in mathematics, Luo Wu Xue, Zhizhi school.
sentence.Network_cn: 所定课目有: 语文学 、 象数学 、 格物学 、 致知学.

这是个比较罕见的倾向明显的定义。不过，这里还有两个问题需要进一步分辨：一、薛氏所说的“语文学”（philology），类似于我国传统的章句、训诂之学，强调语言研究和文献研究两者并重；二、与之相应，他批评旨在审美的纯文.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the Greek sense): current usage (late 17th cent.) from French philologie, via Latin from Greek philologia 'love of learning' (see philo-, -logy)

entry.def: Philology is the study of words, especially the history and development of the words in a particular language or group of languages.

means.word_mean: 1. the humanistic study of language and literature
